evidence.text: Person A: Well...? Don't you wanna get home to your pregnant wife?

Person B: Of course I do.
Person B: No, it's a deliberation. You were ready to send this man to prison, maybe forever, just like that.

Person A: He doesn't have to. The "burden of proof" is on the prosecution. Does anyone have even the slightest hesitation that James Sythe is guilty?
Person A: If you have to think, you're aren't sure.
Person A: We all have lives. None of us want to be here.
Person A: You just like pissing me off, then?

Person A: I'm just saying the man saw somebody at that railing, right? Can we all agree on that?
Person A: So, isn't it possible that he saw someone other than James Sythe?

Person A: That's between him and the Judge.
Person B: Bullshit. You were there.
Person A: He was investigating the case on his own. The Judge sent him home.
Person A: And we're just supposed to take your word for it and change our vote?
Person B: I'm just telling you what I know.
Person A: Hold up. I'm hearing way too many "maybes."
Person B: Too many maybes is reasonable doubt.
Person B: No it's not. You're wearing people down. Talking loud and saying nothing. You go over anything enough times, you'll start to question it.

Person B: Then how am I sitting here?
Person B: I should be dead.
Person B: Little over three years ago I wrapped my car around a tree with a blood alcohol level that probably should've killed me before I even got in the car. And somehow, I walked away with barely a scratch.

Person B: Did he ever lie to you?
Person B: Do you think he lied on the witness stand?
Person A: I'm not sure.
Person B: Not sure is reasonable doubt.
